title: Ticket #1478: Windows condor_submit -name && spooled files.
description:
If a job is submitted to a remote (linux) schedd from a windows machine with authorization as CLAIMTOBE. 

via: condor_submit -name <remote_schedd> -spool

jobs will execute fine but output files will not be accessible, unless the user has a matching account on the schedd. 

condor_tranfer_data.exe -name <remote_schedd> <clusterid>

/////////// begin SchedLog snip

ReliSock: put_file: Failed to open file /var/lib/condor/spool/cluster330.proc0.subproc0/_condor_stderr, errno = 13. DoUpload: (Condor error code 13, subcode 13) SCHEDD at 10.34.33.58 failed to send file(s) to <:3273>: error reading from /var/lib/condor/spool/cluster330.proc0.subproc0/_condor_stderr: (errno 13) Permission denied; TOOL failed to receive file(s) from <1:44461> generalJobFilesWorkerThread(): failed to transfer files for job 330.0 ERROR - Staging of job files failed!

/////////// end SchedLog snip
remarks:
Update to target trunk as this is not a regression, but a long standing bug.

2010-Dec-01 12:10:05 by tstclair:
bug does not appear to exist when running 7.4.X CM against 7.5.5 exec node, going to install older vers and give it a whirl there.
creator: tstclair
